One of THE best co-op games. Singleplayer is up there among the best too.

Парадоксальным образом большая часть нашего хвалебного текста отведена критике. Но это критика восторженных, бесконечно влюбленных в Portal людей. Это критика тех, кто прошел Portal не как запойный алкоголик, за уик-энд, а растягивал удовольствие неделями. Это критика тех, кто летом 2010-го по три раза ходил на одну и ту же E3-презентацию, а затем пересказывал ее коллегам в баре. Portal 2 — это, безусловно, разочарование. Но по уровню, мастерству исполнения, вкусу и изобретательности оно стоит иных триумфов.

Oh man i bet i could go on and on about this game but i'll summarise my thoughts (for simplicities sake)

First! portals, the developers render them beutifully and it still runs extremely well (I run it on a windows 10 hp laptop)

Second! Story, once again beutiful (am i spelling that righ? eh, doesn't matter) it has a few wonderfully placed twists and an ending, oh man the ending! I can gaurantee satisfaction as it left me gleaming with it

Third! Puzzles, except at the start the puzzles are just that right enough amount of challenging to make the sense of accomlishment and not to easy to make it feel boring

Last! My Rating, if you can't tell 10/10, 100%, A+, and whatever other amazing number stuffs that I cant think of.

Actual Last! Would highly recomend to anyone who enjoyed the first portal or loves semi-challenging puzzle games

thanks for reading and enjoy portalling :)

Apparently I haven't written a review for this game, so I guess I will now.

For starters, this game is the reason I got a Steam account in the first place. My brother's friend came over with the 360 disc and I stayed up all night playing. Then, of course, he took the game when he left. I immediately wanted to continue playing,  I was hooked from that point forward. Played through the entirety of it on some awful computer and getting 20 FPS average. It was worth every second of it, honestly. 

The campaign is, of course, one of the standout singleplayer modes of gaming. The difficulty curve is well-done, the humor is always well-executed and there's tons of places to listen to additional dialogue if you feel like waiting to see what happens.
Then, of course, the co-op is a solid continuation of said singleplayer but continues the curve with the addition of a second set of portals and, of course, another person to cooperate with. I have tons of good memories with friends and randoms alike, especially the moments where you have to decide if you REALLY want to solve right then and there or if you want to move the bridge your partner's relying on.
And, to top it all off, there's a leaderboard system that allows you to go for least time/portals with your friends. To this day I occasionally check on my scores to make sure nobody's beaten them, and it's always a pleasant surprise when someone has.

All in all, the game's simply amazing. If the fact that it's the #1 rated game on Steam with 121,015 Positive reviews to 1,586 Negative doesn't indicate its sheer quality, I don't know what will. It's a great game that came from a time when Valve still made them, and it will forever hold a special place in my heart.

My favourite game! It has a fair percentage of incredible gameplay and astonishing scenery and focuses on that while also having an incredibly interesting story (although gameplay is the main factor for my love for this game!)

There is nothing I could praise that probably hasn't been praised already. I love everything about this game. I've owned it for years and still play it occasionally. Excellent and unique in it's execution and simple intuitive controls. Multiple modes give it superb long term playability, especially when combined with the Perpetual Testing Initiative. If you haven't bought it, do it!

If you love the first Portal, you'll definitely love this one too. Portal 2 is more bigger, the story is deepen, much more to explore until the game can be consider an adventure game too, and even more better than the first Portal. 

The gameplay, story, humor, graphics, voice acting and music are all supercalifragilisticexpialidocious. 

The only con for me is that I wish Valve create even more puzzles before releasing Portal 2, for this the last Portal we'll ever got since one of Valve's policy is to never make a 3rd game. But hey, if you want more Portal try 'Portal Stories: Mel'. 

Overall, I highly recommended purchasing Portal 2. One of the best game ever made.

这是比较老的一款V社游戏，剧情通关时间9小时，steam夏季特卖5元购入。
主要玩法就是通过打开传送门，运用“物理定律”，以及场景物件来通过障碍，到达终点。
开始玩游戏，给这个玩法惊艳到了，传送门的打开，给人一种错乱的空间感，有趣。
剧情和对话也是挺逗的。
Favorite game of all time.

Esse jogo é incrível
Há muitas palavras que definem esse jogo mas incrível é o bastante para resumir

Portal já era um jogo incrível, com puzzles desafiadores que te fazem pensar bastante para prosseguir, uma trilha sonora sensacional, a história que há por trás do jogo e é claro, GLaDOS, a inteligência artificial que nos vigia durante toda nossa estadia na Aperture Science

Portal 2 consegue trazer tudo que seu antecessor tinha e deixar melhor, mas o jogo também traz novidades:
- Novas mecânicas para solucionar puzzles como lasers, um gel que faz você pular mais alto e um que faz você correr muito rápido, entre outros
- O encerramento da incrível história do jogo
- Um sensacional modo cooperativo, para você jogar com seus amigos e se aventurar pelos testes em dupla
- Criador de salas para você criar suas próprias câmaras de teste e compartilhar com o mundo
- O carismático Wheatley, uma nova inteligência artificial que nos ajuda ao longo do jogo

Além de tudo isso, Portal 2 roda em praticamente qualquer PC e também pode garantir horas de jogatina tanto com as campanhas single e multiplayer, tanto com os mapas criados pela comunidade

Portal 2 está, sem nenhuma dúvida, recomendadíssimo!

Not much can be said about a game which is already known to be terrific for almost a decade now.

This is a great and unique game which you may enjoy even if you're not usually into puzzle games.
It's also a huge improvement over the previous game, which in itself was also great.
There's much more emphasis on storytelling this time, as well as (and not in the expense of) the gameplay.
At first when I didn't know this installment is also significantly longer, I went through it feeling a bit disappointed, thinking I'm playing a slightly cleverer Portal clone, but I was in for a nice surprise after I figured out that I was barely mid-way through the game and there were much more conecpts and areas implemented in to the game, and many things to explore.

The environment is obviously done extremely well, the graphics are refined and look well, and thanks to the flexibility of the Source engine it looks terrific on powerful machine & also can pull through with weaker computers.

The devs put a great effort (and succeeded) in making the difficulty balanced, not too easy and not too tough, letting you get to the satisfaction of solving a puzzle and (mostly) not to the frustration of failing to find a solution.
Also, since the game is much longer than the previous one, it can be intense at times to go through more and more chambers of puzzles, and the devs also thought carefully about that and provided some lighter phases throughout the game when there's a bit less thinking and a bit more exploration&advancement through the environment. That's brilliant!

The in-game commentary is also an appreciated feature and was an interesting insight of the game.
Along with the possibility to play multiplayer over the network, and also creating a separate multiplayer campaign, plus the ability to easily play community-made maps from inside the game itself, giving you a perfect experience, especially for the puzzle-solving loverrs, which is yet to be matched by any other game.
